meanings.definition: The main clause in a conditional sentence.
meanings.sent1: In the sentence, the apodosis clearly states the result.
meanings.sent2: The apodosis comes after the if-clause in a conditional sentence.
meanings.sent3: The apodosis was the star of the sentence, stealing the show.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the apodosis of happiness, brightening the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of the apodosis for clarity.

meanings.definition: The consequent part of a conditional sentence.
meanings.sent1: If it rains, the apodosis will be to bring an umbrella.
meanings.sent2: The apodosis shows the result that follows the condition.
meanings.sent3: The apodosis decided to take a break and relax in the sun.
meanings.sent4: His apology was the apodosis of his regret, sincere and heartfelt.
meanings.sent5: The apodosis of her decision was evident in her actions.
